intro: Morisonia elegans, commonly known as the elegant morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often hairy. Morisonia elegans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and wetlands.
